intro: Lychnis parviflora, commonly known as the lesser catchfly, is a herbaceous plant belonging to the Caryophyllaceae family. It is characterized by its low-growing habit, with slender stems and small, clustered flowers that range in color from pink to red. The plant typically produces delicate, hairy leaves that are opposite in arrangement. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in meadows, woodlands, and along stream banks. Lychnis parviflora is known for its short blooming period in late spring to early summer.
